descriptionHtml:
[center][color=#ff7700][size=6]ISR - Immersive Speechcraft Reqtified[/size][/color][/center]
This mod changes a bunch of mechanics of Requiem and Immersive Speechcraft for better balance and more immersive experience.

I missed the olds days when speech used to be a powerful weapon in role-playing games, so I was really happy when I found [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63874/?]Immersive Speechcraft[/url] by SirSalami. However, as a Requiem player I deeply care about game difficulty, and I felt like that mod needed some restrictions for the balance's sake. With this patch I tried to add Immersive Speechcraft's mechanics into the world of Requiem, while staying as close as possible to Requiem's feeling.

[color=#ff7700][size=4]Requirements:[/size][/color]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/19281/?]Requiem[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/63874/?]Immersive Speechcraft[/url]
All requirements of mentioned mods.

[color=#ff7700][size=4]List of changes made by this patch:[/size][/color]
[list]
[*]Modified Speech perk tree.
[*]Added perk requirement for many dialogue options from Immersive Speechcraft.
[*]Removed restriction of Immersive Speechcraft that allowed player to only use it's dialogue on NPC's with vanilla voicesets, instead, dialogue is now limited to playable races.
[*]Removed Requiem's disguise perk, as it wasn't functioning correctly.
[*]Changed dialogue branches to only show clean text, without added (Fight) etc.
[/list]
Load order doesn't matter, as long as you load ISR after both it's masters.
I'm not a native english speaker, so please report any typos/gramatic issues you might encounter.
Also bugs, report them too.
[list]
